name: Multiplication and division with standard form 1

skills.name: Perform multiplication calculations using standard form
Convert from non-standard form into standard form for numbers greater than 1
Convert from non-standard form into standard form for numbers less than 1

explanations.A: I think you subtracted 1 from the power as the 30 has been divided by 10. However these two sides are equal, so if the 30 is divided by 10 how could we balance this out?
explanations.B: If you multiply 30 by 10 5 times, you don't get the same as multiplying 3 by 10 5 times. How many times would you need to multiply 3 by 10 to get the same?
explanations.C: Comparing the numbers, we can see that there is 30 on the left-hand side and 3 on the right-hand side. Noting that 30 = 3 × 10¹, we can substitute this in to the left-hand side to give 3 × 10¹ × 10⁵. We have two powers of 10 which are multiplied, meaning we can add the powers to give 3 × 10⁶. This now looks like the right-hand side, and so ★ = 6
explanations.D: I think you multiplied the power by 10 as you need to balance out the 30 divide by 10. How many times do we x by 10 to cancel out a divide by 10? Remember the power is how many times we multiply by 10.

explanations.A: I think you multiplied the power by 100 as you need to balance out the 950 divide by 100. How many times do we x by 10 to cancel out a divide by 100? Remember the power is how many times we multiply by 10
explanations.B: If you multiply 950 by 10 7 times, you don't get the same as multiplying 9.5 by 10 7 times. How many times would you need to multiply 9.5 by 10 to get the same?
explanations.C: I think you subtracted 2 from the power as the 950 has been divided by 100. However these two sides are equal, so if the 950 is divided by 100 how could we balance this out?
explanations.D: Comparing the numbers, we can see that there is 950 on the left-hand side and 9.5 on the right-hand side. Noting that 950 = 9.5 × 10², we can substitute this in to the left-hand side to give 9.5 × 10² × 10⁷. We have two powers of 10 which are multiplied, meaning we can add the powers to give 9.5 × 10⁹. This now looks like the right-hand side, and so ★ = 9

explanations.A: Comparing the numbers, we can see that there is 0.3 on the left-hand side and 3 on the right-hand side. Noting that 0.3 needs to be multiplied by 10 to get to 3, group the powers of 10 already on the left-hand side differently: 0.3 × 10^5 = 0.3 × 10¹ × 10⁴ = 3 × 10⁴. This now looks like the right-hand side, and so ★ = 4
explanations.B: If you multiply 0.3 by 10 5 times, you don't get the same as multiplying 3 by 10 5 times. How many times would you need to multiply 3 by 10 to get the same?
explanations.C: I think you added 1 to the power as the 0.3 has been multiplied by 10. However these two sides are equal, so if the 0.3 is multiplied by 10 how could we balance this out?
explanations.D: I think you multiplied the power by 10 as the 0.3 was multiplied by 10. How many times do we divide by 10 to cancel out a multiply by 10? Remember the power is how many times we multiply by 10

explanations.A: I think you multiplied the power by 100 as the 0.095 was multiplied by 100. How many times do we divide by 100 to cancel out a multiply by 100? Remember the power is how many times we multiply by 10
explanations.B: If you multiply 0.095 by 10 7 times, you don't get the same as multiplying 9.5 by 10 7 times. How many times would you need to multiply 9.5 by 10 to get the same?
explanations.C: Comparing the numbers, we can see that there is 0.095 on the left-hand side and 9.5 on the right-hand side. Noting that 0.095 needs to be multiplied by 100 to get to 9.5, group the powers of 10 already on the left-hand side differently: 0.095 × 10⁷ = 0.095 × 10² × 10⁵ = 9.5 × 10⁵. This now looks like the right-hand side, and so ★ = 5
explanations.D: I think you added 2 to the power as the 0.095 has been multiplied by 100. However these two sides are equal, so if the 0.095 is multiplied by 100 how could we balance this out?

explanations.A: As everything is multiplied, it doesn't matter in which order we write the terms. Changing things around and then using the indices rule of adding powers when the same base number is multiplied gives: 4 × 2 × 10⁷ × 10⁵ = 8 × 10^(7 + 5) = 8 × 10¹².
explanations.B: I think you have multiplied the powers of 10. Remember the power tells us how many times we are multiplying by 10. How many times do we do this in total here?
explanations.C: I think you added the 4 and 2, but remember this is a multiplication
explanations.D: I think you have multiplied the powers of 10. Remember the power tells us how many times we are multiplying by 10. How many times do we do this in total here? Also make sure you are multiplying the whole numbers

explanations.A: I think you added the 8 and 1, but remember this is a multiplication
explanations.B: I think you have multiplied the powers of 10. Remember the power tells us how many times we are multiplying by 10. How many times do we do this in total here?
explanations.C: As everything is multiplied, it doesn't matter in which order we write the terms. Changing things around and then using the indices rule of adding powers when the same base number is multiplied gives: 1 × 8 × 10⁶ × 10⁵ = 8 × 10^(6 + 5) = 8 × 10¹¹.
explanations.D: I think you have multiplied the powers of 10. Remember the power tells us how many times we are multiplying by 10. How many times do we do this in total here? Also make sure you are multiplying the whole numbers

explanations.A: As everything is multiplied, it doesn't matter in which order we write terms. Changing things around and then using the indices rule of adding powers when the same base number is multiplied gives: 4 × 5 × 10⁷ × 10⁵ = 20 × 10^(7 + 5) = 20 × 10¹². The final step is to convert to standard form: 20 × 10¹² = 2 × 10¹ × 10¹² = 2 × 10¹³.
explanations.B: You have the right answer, but this is not in standard form.
explanations.C: I think you have multiplied the powers of 10. Remember the power tells us how many times we are multiplying by 10. How many times do we do this in total here?
explanations.D: I think you got the right answer, but made a mistake when putting it into standard form. Think about how many times 2 needs to be multiplied by 10 to get your original answer

explanations.A: I think you have multiplied the powers of 10. Remember the power tells us how many times we are multiplying by 10. How many times do we do this in total here?
explanations.B: You have the right answer, but this is not in standard form.
explanations.C: As these are all multiplications it doesn't matter in which order we write the terms. Changing things around and then using the indices rule of adding powers when the same base number is multiplied gives: 3 × 2 × 5 × 10² × 10⁵ × 10³ = 30 × 10^(2 + 5 + 3) = 30 × 10¹⁰. The final step is to convert to standard form: 30 × 10¹⁰ = 3 × 10¹ × 10¹⁰ = 3 × 10¹¹
explanations.D: I think you got the right answer, but made a mistake when putting it into standard form. Think about how many times 3 needs to be multiplied by 10 to get your original answer

explanations.A: I think you have multiplied the powers of 10. Remember the power tells us how many times we are multiplying by 10. How many times do we do this in total here?
explanations.B: I think you added the 4.2 and 3, but remember this is a multiplication
explanations.C: I think you got the right answer, but forgot to adjust your power when writing it in standard form. How many times do you need to multiply 1.26 by 10 to get your answer?
explanations.D: As everything is multiplied, it doesn't matter in which order we write the terms. Changing things around and then using the indices rule of adding powers when the same base number is multiplied gives: 4.2 × 3 × 10² × 10⁵ = 12.6 × 10^(2 + 5) = 12.6 × 10⁷. The final step is to convert to standard form: 12.6 × 10⁷ = 1.26 × 10¹ × 10⁷ = 1.26 × 10⁸.

explanations.A: As everything is multiplied, it doesn't matter in which order we write the terms. Changing things around and then using the indices rule of adding powers when the same base number is multiplied gives: 3.1 × 5 × 10¹² × 10⁵ = 15.5 × 10^(12 + 5) = 15.5 × 10¹⁷. The final step is to convert to standard form: 15.5 × 10¹⁷ = 1.55 × 10¹ × 10¹⁷ = 1.55 × 10¹⁸
explanations.B: I think you added the 4.2 and 3, but remember this is a multiplication
explanations.C: I think you got the right answer, but forgot to adjust your power when writing it in standard form. How many times do you need to multiply 1.55 by 10 to get your answer?
explanations.D: I think you have multiplied the powers of 10. Remember the power tells us how many times we are multiplying by 10. How many times do we do this in total here?
